name: Car Mechanic Simulator 2014
description: Now you can own and operate your own auto repair service with PlayWay’s Car Mechanic Simulator 2014. Car Mechanic Simulator 2014 gives you the behind the scenes view of the daily dealings at local garages and dealership repair shops.
minimum_requirements: Минимальные: ОС: Windows XP SP3 / Vista / 7 / 8 Процессор: Core 2 Duo 1.8GHz or AMD equivalent Оперативная память: 2048 MB ОЗУ Видеокарта: GeForce 9800GT or better w /512MB VRAM DirectX: Версии 9.0c Место на диске: 1200 MB Звуковая карта: DirectX compatble
recommended_requirements: Рекомендованные: ОС: Windows XP SP3 / Vista / 7 / 8 Процессор: Core i5 or AMD equivalent Оперативная память: 4096 MB ОЗУ Видеокарта: GeForceGTX  650 Ti or better w/ 1024MB VRAM DirectX: Версии 9.0c Место на диске: 1200 MB Звуковая карта: DirectX compatble

reviews.review_text: Before you ask, no, you won't learn how to replace your busted clutch or how to find that squeaky sound underneath your car- it's not that type of game. What you will find, however, is a great puzzle game that is a breath of fresh air compared to the thousands of other puzzle games out there.  The premise is simple: you own a mechanic shop, and people bring you cars (problems) to fix. You get a short blurb to tell you a bit of information, but the amount of information that you get can vary- going from 'Hey, my battery is dead, can you fix it?' to 'Something squeaks under the car. Fix it.' Your goal is to find and fix the problem while trying not to run out of cash- you get an extra amount of cash for each order, and if that runs out, you can ask the bank for a loan that you have to pay back. To be honest, though, if you're careful about what you buy and aren't replacing stuff willy-nilly, you ought to be fine. Just remember- fix it if you can, or replace it outright if you need to.  And don't worry about losing parts- the game will not only make you remove items in order off the car, but it will also force you to put them back in order, as well- there's no need to worry about missing any parts- unless it's something like a starter or a plastic engine cover, but even then it won't let you mark it as done until the car is completely put back together.  Once each objective is met, you'll be able to mark the car as 'fixed' and send it on its way.  There are over seventy problems in the base game alone- plus another twenty in the DLC pack that comes free with the game. There's another free DLC pack launching later this month with another pack of problems, and that will add even more value to it.   The problems I have with this game are actually somewhat slight- for one, some of the detection on th orders can be really, REALLY picky. If it tells you to replace the right front tire, then your new wheel must go on the right front- you can't just move a used wheel from the other side of the car onto there, because it's not explicitly a new wheel. It's smart to take big orders a step at a time for this reason- work on one region of the car at a time, and replace everything needed- or make notes as to what the busted parts were. There is nothing more swear-worthy in this game than completing a huge order, but being unable to continue because you didn't put some tiny part back in its right space- and then you have to pull the whole blasted thing apart to hunt for it.  The only other complaint I have is that you will want to hit the radio with a wrench and kill it dead after a half-hour of its awful music. If you need music, bust out an iPod or turn on an actual radio, because this one will make you want to take it out to the test track and drive over it a few dozen times. Would it have been too much to ask to get a simple MP3 player in there or something?  All in all, though, if you're looking for a puzzle game that isn't something about jewels, you'll enjoy this- especially if you have an interest in cars.

After reading several reviews and noticing it was on sale, I decided to give this game a try. I have a Quad Core 3.8ghz AMD, GeForce 730 2gb Graphics Card, and 8gb DDR3 RAM. As soon as I loaded up the first vehicle in the game, I experienced low framerates. I exited and changed the video settings to Quality High, Resolution 1280x720, VSync OFF, Antialiasing DISABLED (These are the same settings I use for DayZ, which gives me 40+FPS). I now have 0 drop in framerate, and the game still looks beautiful. I've been an experienced mechanic for over 10 years. I am a certified CNC Machinist, as well as a certified Mercedes-Benz Technician. I've been a gamer since the NES days. The graphics are really good, and I haven't experienced any noticeable bugs, glitches, or clipping issues. The sound is ok, but nothing to brag about. I did listen to the radio, but had turned it down 50% before I even started. I never found it to be annoying. Movement around the shop environment is pretty smooth. No issues there. The game starts every level with a worksheet that explains what the customer wants you to check for or replace. Great thing is, you can refer back to this worksheet at anytime. Most of the parts can be visually inspected without removing them, but a lot of parts can only be inspected upon removing something in front of it (i.e. a timing belt before inspecting the water pump). The electrical components must be checked using the OBD Scan Tool. You are also able to test drive vehicles in order to diagnose bad parts, and the physics are good. Right clicking the mouse opens a menu allowing you to install parts, remove parts, turn the chassis transparency off/on, and turn the parts color, such as red, yellow, and green corresponding to the condition, off/on. Some of the parts can simply be removed, others must be unbolted and bolted back on. Everything must be installed in the reverse order of removal. Yes, you can forget to install parts, but you cannot give the car back to the customer until you fix your mistakes. The game automatically checks tasks off your worksheet as you complete them. After a little over an hour of playing, I found this game to be very fun. I'm impressed that any developer would tackle a game like this, and with such detail. Don't expect it to be 100% realistic, such as every nut and bolt, accurate pricing, names of cars, etc. I don't think anyone could learn the basics of car repair from this game, but I do think someone can use this game to understand the overall concept of automotive repair. I honestly don't have anything bad to say about this game. I wish the concept of this game would've implemented on Forza, Grand Turismo, or Need For Speed a long time ago! If you're interested in automotive repair, get this game now that it's on sale.

This game is brilliant. gives you some understanding, and lets you freeplay around the cars.  Camera is a little bad at times but you will develop your own techniques to counter that.  Also alot of good and free addons, thats a big plus!   Highly recommended!

1. Unscrew lug nuts 2. Take off wheel 3. Unscrew brake caliper bolts 4. Remove brake caliper 5. Inspect brake pads 6. Remove worn brake pads 7. Purchase new brake pads 8. Replace worn brake pads with new brake pads 9. Assemble brake caliper 10. Screw brake caliper bolts 11. Assemble wheel 12. Screw lug nuts 13. Gouge customer with $1,000 brake repair bill 14. Repeat as necessary  Now all your car repair needs can be performed from the comfort of your computer without having to get your hands dirty. You can perform battery replacement, brake repair, tune-ups, replace shocks, repair a clutch, change the oil, fix the suspension, and so much more!

I graduated as a car mechanic back in 1996 and therefore i was very curious how such a game would be. Basically its a good game that delivers an amount of entertainment that matches the pricetag.  Besides replacing spareparts the game has a testcourse where you can drive the car thru obstacles to check that its working properly.....however it always works properly on the test course as bad dampers etc doesnt affect the driving experience, so the test track isnt really of any help in regards of finding out whats wrong with the car.  The missions are straight forward in the sense that you get a sheet listing the problems to be solved and some things are more puzzling that others and that gives the game a touch of reality.  It does kinda lack the things like 'sound and feel' that you get irl when testdriving a car, where youll be able to tell if the dampers are failing, steering is slugish, engine isnt running right aso.  That leaves you with the option to check all the parts and replace the worn ones to ensure theyre working properly. On that part I find it hard to define when the game accepts partially worn, but not worn out, parts to be left on the car or not, sometimes itll accept partially worn parts and other times it has to be 100% condition.  Again, adding some rl touch would highly increase the gameplay, like in a real shop when you get a job where the customer says 'Imma drive 2000 miles on vacation in my car, can you check it and make sure its up for it?' you can get to use your judgement on which parts to replace/fix and based on how well you do it, the customer will be more or less happy about the job you did.  Also adding the ability to buy up used cars, fix them up and puttem out for sale on the lot would be a nice feature as well, kinda like the way you could in 'Gearhead Garage'.  All in all, the game is good and i do recommend it, but I also hope to see some implementation of the features mentioned, I wouldnt mind if it came as addons in the form of DLC @ maybe 10 EUR or so each.

Buy Car Mechanic Simulator  I think this is best way to start my review i have played my fair share of simulators on and off Steam and Car Mechanic Simulator is one i have been craving for very long time i have been around and working on cars since 12 years old so i have good knowledge of cars and there workings.  First appearance of the game when we start up is clean and simple which are good but some option need to be added which they will in upcoming patch.  We start career mode and get under way graphics are good for simulator maybe little heavy on the reflection nice chrome texture we get first job you have job sheet which gives you rough idea what issue maybe and you need to find and fix this issue in start this can be little tricky but there are some things you can use to help make game play easier with high lighted parts etc  Controls are very nice and smooth once setup feel great no major issues  Test drive mode is low on scale but does help in sourcing the issues same with the scanner etc  mission do slowly get harder and harder but for some people they might find it repetitive but i liked it its not to hard so some one with no car knowledge could play it  It took me around 20 hours to complete the game which is good for simulator and developers have been more than helpful when facing an issue and im looking forward to DLC and possible 2015 version its a game which as lots of space to grow and become bigger i hope the developers run with that and build on what they have.  Some people wont like the game and some will and for what the game is the price is right  my rating is 10/10

Pros:  Fun Great Simulator (even though its the 2014 one)  Cons:  Not to much options for the car its self, like customisation  When you get stuck there needs to be a Tip or help Button (im not sure if thats in 2015 Game)  Overall Opinion Very Good Game   7 / 10   I would Recomment this!

It's okay and very good on knowing it's parts but it could use alot more, perhaps An ability to hire another mechanic to talk to about the problems of the car (Rookie will give minor tips to Expert will give alot of tips and sometimes even tell you what's wrong...)

Okay, this game is actually better than you would expect. You can't get into the engine blocks or heads, but pretty much everything else that a mechanic would have to deal with on a vehicle from a 4 banger engine up to a V8. The parts in the cars are all set up the same, give or take, so you're not learning Ford, Chevy and Dodge etc. You have the option to repair certain parts to save money. All in all WELL WORTH the money if you are even slightly interested in Simulators or Car Mechanics.

I recommend this game solely because it is fun. But it leaves a lot to be desired. This is a review about as game that could have been much better, and instead is just a fun play if you get it cheap.  The 'simulation' aspect is weak. I am not saying that the game is bad, I am saying that I wish it was better. For instance, a customer's car won't start: I thought it would be a good idea to check the battery cables but alas there are none. There are also no radiators, no fluid in the transmissions, no tire pressure, the list goes on.   The game also features repairs of an individual part; you can, apparently, repair a water pump! I have never known a mechanic to repair something like that. Maybe it can be done but typically they just install a new part on your car and charge you for it. The only part-repairs I have seen are things like splicing wires or welding a busted exhaust pipe. Simple stuff.  The pricing is crazy too. People are spending over 10,000 USD to repair used cars. Things like a new battery cost 350 USD even though they can typically be had for under 100 USD in real life. Other things are odd too, spark plugs are 35 USD but again in real life they are perhaps 2-5 USD.   The game play gets tiring. In the beginning you are using your mind to try and troubleshoot problems and find a damaged part. As the game goes on you learn to, 1: diagnostic scan; 2: test drive; 3: path test; 4: click hide body and show part condition. 9/10 times it will show the damaged parts in red and then you just have to spend the time disassembling the vehicle. The only time this won't show you the damaged part is if its in the transmission or if its the air filter. Very little challenge at that point.  The 4X4 add on is a good idea but it mostly consists of unlicensed Jeep Wrangler models. Not One Pickup, Not on Land Rover, Not One V8, Not One Lift Kit.  The 1/4 mile add on is the best part of the game. In the beginning you have limited money to upgrade the parts and tune a car to hit a 1/4 mile time. This too grows easy over time as the budget increases you start having enough money to simply buy ALL the performance parts for each car. Most of the bolt-ons give ridiculous amounts of extra power. Worst of all, there are no Cold Air Intakes in a performance shop - just crazy. Unfortunately, while drag racing there is no shifting to be done by the player even though many of the vehicles have manual transmissions. What a shame, its one of the main aspects of drag racing titles that you find on your mobile phone.  This could have been an incredible game - and I hope they make another one, because developers can usually build on simulations until they are truly great. For now, its a fun game and I gladly played through the whole thing. I think its enjoyable, but it won't give you any real world knowledge. It might be damaging if you learned that its normal to pay 800 USD for a mechanic to install a new battery, or perhaps you think that your transmission ought not have any fluid in it. I don't consider this any more educational than I do Need For Speed Hot Pursuit. But its still fun - Happy Gaming.

I haven't finished it yet, but so far I'm not at all disappointed.  Pros: Even better than Visible Engine. It does a really great job of showing the basic mechanics of a car. The symptoms seem to correlate well to the solutions, but I'm no mechanic. I'm actually motivated to do some work on my own car now that I have a better idea of how things fit together.  Cons: I think my mechanic is drunk. What is with the first person interface? Is the shop on a boat? Some of the parts are very difficult to get in view of the camera.  I'd love to see more detailed engines, some cut scenes would be nice, a project car for your mechanic to work on on the side would be cool. High performance parts.. Engine noise troubleshooting with actual sound clips would be really neat.   Overall it's a pretty great game. Well worth the 15-20 bucks.
It would be an okay game if my laptop wasn't inadequate unfortunately with a low-end laptop it really does struggle to the point where it is simply unplayable
great game for beginners. You have to have a general idea about cars but dont have to be an expert by any means. Itll teach you ALOT

This is my first review, I normally do not make reviews but I seen a lot of people bashing this game. This game is not need for speed, you do not upgrade cars or make them faster. It's simply a game where you repair customers cars. If you ever played gear head garage and liked it you will like this game.   The game can get old pretty quick, it becomes a puzzle sometimes repairing cars but that's what happens in real life to a mechanic.   The test track is useless and doesn't offer any real way of trouble shooting what's wrong with a car. If the clutch is bad the car still drives fine etc.  The career mode is repetitive and towards the end offers nothing except the enjoyment of fixing cars. They have only two different motors so far and I'm towards the end. You only replace basic parts on the car. Nothing internal in the engine itself just external stuff.   The game is simple and if you do not know much about cars you could kinda learn the basics from this game. I recommend this if your a car/motor enthusiast but if your looking for something on the lines of NFS stay away.

Some people are complaining that this isn't as detailed as they'd like it to be, or that it's not a true mechanic simulator. I don't think it's meant to be...otherwise we could use this as the first step in a Mechanics qualification. (Which would be cool by the way!)  I like to think of it as a puzzle game. I mean, what is being a mechanic, if it's not a puzzle? You have to find out what's wrong and fix it. Same thing here. Except, it doesn't overwhelm the player with all the aspects of being a mechanic.  I would've liked a bit more of a tutorial, especially when you get your new garages, as when I got the 3rd garage, it asked me to do a chip tuning. I had no idea what this meant. Just looking around, I found a new door...went in, and then haphazardly clicked on things, until it worked. Yeah, there's a little 'guide' in the chip tuning, but it doesn't tell you much.  It might get repetitive...but, think about it. If you're a proper mechanic, surely you've done the same things over and over...so it does give you a sense of what it's like in that respect.  The only downside...is the test track. On the repair orders, it could say 'There's a horrid noise when I change gear', or 'When I go faster, there's this whining from the rear of my car.' Well...there isn't. When you get one of those jobs, and go out in the car...you expect to hear what the client is talking about...but you don't. That would've been a great thing...to hear and feel the car handling differently, based on what was wrong. But, it seems that the test track, and even the path test indoors, are just formalities, with no real indication to you, the player, as to what's wrong. It's just a way to automatically highlight problems when you're examining the car. It would've been so much nicer, and realistic, if these problems were actually in the test track area...  The only one that is reflected in the test track...is when the problem is, that the car wont even start. At least that one's there...lol.  This is a Car Mechanic simulator, as much as Farming Simulator is a simulator for farming. It's got the basics, and honestly, if they added more, it could be so much better. The framework is there...  I enjoy this game, and I can see myself playing for a long time. Especially if they let the modding community at it.

I'm currently a student at a school for mechanics and believe it or not this game helped me study some more on the parts yes it is missing a lot but it is a good game to learn some basic stuff on. I recommend this to new guys interested in the car field.
One of the best games I have ever played, definitely recommend it for 60 cents and full price. It's so relaxing and just fun how you progress in the game.

I enjoyed this game a lot. When I read negative reviews I nearly didnt buy it and that would have been a shame. I had so much fun :)  I read some people complaining about it being too hard unless you're already a mechanic. I have to agree that I dont think this game is for young kids. It is for the mechanics/car interested teen/adult. It was perfect for me because I only knew a little about car mechanics and now I have learned a lot.   The game is quite small but the game play part of troubleshooting and using diagnostic tools is nice. The description say 'Deal with customers' but the only part I have seen is an order report, so I never actually saw any customers or had dialogue with them. That also makes it hard to know what customers actually want fixed. Eg. 'Replace all damaged parts' does that mean you want everything less than 100% condition repaired or is 90+% okay? You can't finish the order until the customer is 100% satisfied but you cant ask them what's missing.

Fairly decent simulator game where you role play a mechanic fixing issues with cars. Clients come in with requests ranging from checking tire pressure to full on engine block replacements or undercarriage repairs. It kinda works as a puzzle game, in that you need to know what is required to be done and what parts need removing to get to the parts needing a fix. Knowing this saves you time labouriously taking every removable piece of the car out.  Outside of the garage, you may be asked to test out how a car handles after you've done repairs. You get to drive the car in either third person or in-car view around a short test track. Controls are very basic but functional at least in getting the job done.  It really is nothing that special, but there isn't inherently wrong with it. It looks semi-decent, gameplay is relatively relaxing, there isn't any time limit pressure on completing objectives. I recommend doing it while listening to music or the radio. It's really one of those games that passes the time, nothing more.  Overall, it's just another basic simulator game, so easy to make as all you need to do is think of a mundane job/task and build a game around that. A load of them are an absolute joke (with Goat Simulator being the ultimate simulator joke - I think that was made to purely mock the banality of the genre). It's relatively fine gameplay-wise and at the end of the day, that's really all that matters. It also has a slight puzzle element to it as to try to locate the problem with a client's car and fix it. So I'd tentatively recommend it, even though the oversaturation of these mundane simulators is getting pretty ridiculous on Steam these days.

This game is not bad as far as what ive played. I did my education in the auto world, so this game is interesting for me to see what the actual parts under/on a car look like and how it fits. But, if you know nothing about cars, i would suggest not to purchase
This is actually a decent little game, tons of details and very good for learning how cars work. Definitely worth a try for anyone interested in cars.

This game is very addictive. Like a great mobile game, little chunks of gameplay, easy to pick up but always time for 'just one more'. The graphics are pretty good and certainly are clear and compliment the gameplay. The additional parts such as the test drives and diagnostic run are less developed and are a bit of a chore but do add variety.  I think this game shows a lot of potential for the concept, I will be on the watch for any sequel that may be produced.
It's good, but... It get's really boring after a while becouse the work orders are pretty much the same troughout. Also there is not enough details to examine/replace.
An interesting simulation that actually teaches you about cars, the parts of a car and how they work, and possibly even how to fix a car in some cases.
It's an OK game, the new 4x4 add on has a couple of bugs on orders 13 and 17 which won't let you progress unless you replace every part of the car.  Apart from that, I carry on playing it.
Very fun game may not sounds so but try for yourself and you will see the magic of this game

I'm writing this after completing the first tutorial order. So far, the game seems fairly enjoyable as well as educational to a reasonable degree. The graphics are fine, nothing too fancy, but fits the game. The music has an electronic flare, which I found fit the game, but some may disagree (it can be muted). The gameplay itself is what you would expect from a simulator, it's straight foreward and not too difficult to grip. The one Issue I had was with the controls, they do feel a bit clunky, even after modifying some of the mouse settings, but it's not unbearable. The $20 price tag seems a bit high (I got the game on sale), but if you're a diehard fan of simulators or automotive themed games, than I would reccomend this game.

This game was enjoyable. I like cars, so it was nice to be able to work on them and not actually get greasy. The camera is kind of clunky, but once you get the zoom and pan down, you will be ripping through these. Definitely need to do all of the testing (OBDII, track, and brake/suspension) to make life easier than pulling everything off and redoing it. The game can be completed without doing the bank loan, and frankly I didnt see the 'sell inventory' button until I was playing the DLC (eyefinity moved it to the third monitor). A great non-violent alternative to some games that are out today, and a a great time waster. Thoroughly enjoyed.
love this game would highly recommend it to anyone who is considering of buying this.
ok but very very repetative
An interesting simulation that actually teaches you about cars, the parts of a car and how they work, and possibly even how to fix a car in some cases.

This is an ok game with hellish music. I got me to learn a lot about what these parts actually mean (by alt-tabbing and checking Wikipedia) It is sort of like 'World of Guns: Gun Disassembly' but for cars.  The music is hellish and my advice is to turn it off ASAP. It is like nails-on-chalkboard for me.  Some thing are unintuitive and weird and smell of bad game design (buying used parts only to find out they won't let you pass the mission)  Grab it for $5 on a sale.

This is probobly the best game ive playn. I bought this game because I wanted to know a car inside out. And honestly this game perfects that. I Really think they should even use this in school as a pre-teach before getting into the real car. ill have to say now I know substantial things about a car. This game is Amazing 10/10, if your a full gear head and have a passion to learn about it get this game. I dont regret buying this game!   P.S To the creators Only thing I think you guys should add is a Dyno !
Recommend 8/10

The idea is good, very good, but way to far to be called a simulator... The most simplest job in the game is changeing brake pads on a disc brake system. In the game all you do is... 1. take the wheel off 2. take the caliper off 3. remove the pads from the brake rotor 4. Replace the old pads with new pads 5. Reinstall the Caliper 6. Put the wheel back on. In real life this is the basics, but so far from the actual thing, its great for the casual gamer who dosen't know anything about cars, but when you do this stuff for a living its somewhat silly and mundane. If your wondering how many steps their actually is to replace the brake pads in real life... 1. Break all lugs on wheels 2. Jack car up 3. Remove all wheels 4. Disconnect all brake lines from calipers and allow time to bleed off. 5. Remove calipers 6. Remove brake pads from Caliper 7. Compress cylinder within Caliper to allow new Pads to fit 8. Install new pads to fit 9. Reinstall all Calipers with Pads 10. Not a bad idea to check the rotors as well, Replace if worn or galded 11. Reconnect brake lines to all Calipers 12. In respect to the posistion of the Master Cylinder start from the farthest corner and work inwards bleeding the calipers to fit, make sure no air is in the lines. 13. When bleeding your Brake system pump your brake pedal and depress on the third pump, while another person cracks the bleeder on the caliper, repeat until clear fluid is coming out. 14. Frequently check the Master Cylinder to ensure it is not empty when you are bleeding the brake system. 15. If everything checks out, put your wheels back on and torque them to their respective torque rateing. But in all honesty, if the game did this i would be impressed, and probably not want to play, that sounds like a lot of work. There are also some things that ♥♥♥♥♥♥ me off, like stupid ♥♥♥♥ that your best position to remove a starter is from the top of the engine compartment, and rubber bushings just slide out, and even the fact that everything you do is by hand with a wrench. Not going to lie, i like this game, i suggest you buy it if you wanna get some general car knowledge, but this thing is far from a simulator.
Thought it was going to be a business type sim, more like managing a garage and employees lol. Good game still, when stuck just look on forum, lots of helpful tips on missions.
Google search simulator 2014.
Great game !!! A lots of level.

It seems this game went on sale the other day... It seems to have thrown a wrench into my plans... I'm exhausted from playing this game so much... It really seemed to have sparked my interest... But seriously give me a brake I can only do so many car puns.   I found this game to be rather enjoyable. All those years I took shop class instead of home econonics finally paid off. I'm very interested in trying out 2015 after watching the demo video. But would buy on sale again!   Just a few tips for anyone who gets stuck in career mode. Make sure the oil is over half-way on the dipstick and make sure to check all the rubber bushings on the suspension. A few times I was caught trying to figure out what obscure detail I had missed. Also make sure to use all the tests to your disposal (OBD, diagnostic path, test course), makes it easier to identify parts that are worn out.  I will be looking at supporting this developer for 2016!   (As of this review I have not completed the 4x4 missions yet)
This game is ♥♥♥♥ing amazing. Even if you know nothing about fixing cars, i would still recommend this game. 10/10

Wow! This is way more than what I expected! Just the testing of the cars is simulator quality. While the learning possible within the game is unvaluabele! I feel I stole this game on the summer sale for only 2.45 USD

*** I have 20+ hours of play in this game on another account. Not the few minutes it says.***  I am someone who doesn't know anything about cars. I bought this game so I could learn some basic starter information. I not only have learned about where a water pump normally exists, but also found the game fun to play. I found the controls a little odd, but not too difficult to work with, but it didn't prevent me from enjoying the game.  The graphics are very clean, and the way the game colors parts of the car allows for me to easily identify different components.  The music is limited in its selection, but one of the channels is perfect for me in that it plays a hard rock style guitar song and so I just listen to that channel.  Overall, I have learned just what I wanted from the game. Where parts are, the names of different parts, and how various parts link together. It's a fun game if you are looking for exactly what I wanted, which was to learn some very basic things about a car engine and where things are located in a car.

Just before you go: ''Oh look another German simulator game'' This is actually pretty well done, desinged and looks damn good.  Few minor bugs here and there. This game has some-what depth in it. Cars, models, polygons, music, car parts and tools.  Recommended to all gearheads. Buy while it's still on sale!

An astoundingly relaxing title for those who enjoy a little logical problem solving wrapped up in a neat little educational package. At no point could the game be considered a replacement for a formal mechanical education, but as you progress through job after job a little common sense goes a long way, and patterns emerge as you learn to associate particular faults and issues with components. While this will not help you put together that kit-car you’ve promised yourself for 20 years, it will give you an insight into the likely causes of common problems and test your ability to narrow down the offending item.  Reasonably priced, well-polished for its price point and even a little educational – a very reasonable product indeed for anyone who wants to get a feeling for the causes of common car problems, or if you just enjoy a little problem solving.
Spent 25 minutes trying to figure out how the game worked after the 3 second tutorial that teaches you how to walk and click. 10/10.
Gappar is a ♥♥♥♥ing ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥, but I love him because is one of my best friends
Fun game! A very good intro to car repairs. Very fun gameplay with progression and increasing complexity.
Already love this game
Very nice game, I have 1% knowledge about car, after playing this game for awhile, it raises my car knowledge to 20%.

>do first mission >buys and replaces ♥♥♥♥♥♥ brake pads with new ones >completes mission >do third mission  >do everything correctly >go to the wheel and dismantle everything >doing something I wasn't initially supposed to do >dismantle the front two wheels and their brake calipers and replace their new brake pads with the old ♥♥♥♥♥♥ ones >checks off mission   10/10 will jiffy lube again

Some people may remember a gem of PC gaming history called Gearhead Garage. This is basically that game, but much, much better.  And I have to give Gearhead Garage props, that game sucked me in for hours when I was younger. It was incredibly simple, and can probably be easily converted to a flash game at this point.  So you can imagine my elation when I saw this game. Since it was indie, I didn't want to pay full price. I've been burned by too many boring, broken, or incomplete indie games in the past on Steam. I can say, knowing what I know now, I would definitely pay full price for it.  At this point I am addicted to it. For me, that is being stuck at work, and looking forward to getting home and playing th is game to unwind. I usually play for an hour or so at a time (I'm a casual gamer). That's pretty rare for me, only other games to do this are bigger hits like GTA V or The Last of Us.  I'm a huge car nut, so I very much enjoy this game. I've tinkered in real life. Granted, the game completely simplifies all the repairs, but it's still satisfying and doesn't feel mundane or boring.  I also really like the fact that you can 'learn' things such as increasing profits, reducing parts prices in the catalog, or increasing the speed of removing bolts.  Each scenario feels like a puzzle, and a few times I've been stumped and had to look something up online. If you have any automotive experience, some of the jobs are easier for you to tackle, since you've probably experienced it in real life; e.g. tires are wearing out fast (suspension), car shuts of randomly (fuel pump), etc. If you don't have experience, you will probably learn a thing or two, that is pretty cool.  As far as graphics/sound/controls. The graphics seem slightly unoptimized, FPS can dip down once you're in the shop, but the graphics don't look incredibly detailed. Sounds are average, nothing amazing there. Controls aren't too bad, the camera can be annoying sometimes with how it zooms. But after a while you'll get to a point where you're flying through all the interactions and whatnot, so it's easy to get the hang and feel of.  If you're a car nut like me, and have actually worked on cars before, this can be a fun romp for you. I'd definitely recommend trying this game out, it is well polished, and well executed. Big kudos to the developers!
good controls nice graphics perfect soundtrack  9/10

VERY SUPRISED by how awesome this game is! Feels like a finished product for a change, not like other simulator games! Great sounds, great graphics, easy keyboard layout and generally fun to play, learning about different parts and problem finding.   Starts off telling you how to move around and using the action key to interact with your environment, then it lets you do your own thing; completing jobs, buying books to learn more (to level up), test driving the cars etc. Levelling up through the game gives you bigger garages and better tools!   Definitely worth the money and would recommend to anyone who loves cars and simulation games.

We started to think badly of the word 'simulator' lately, but sometimes there is flower where you would not think of it. The game is fun, and extremely well done on graphocs and game engine. The potential is huge. The pros are atelier work and puzzle part of the game. The cons are the driving part is not connectred to the car's status.
Not bad, not bad at all!

Fun and exciting game,  this game can deffently teach kids and/or older people that you can repair your car yourself. And that it isn't as hard as you believe.  Most of these things i knew how to do. thats what comes out of owning a Audi.

A fun and relaxing game. I'm not even kind of experienced with cars but the game is very accessible. The only thing I would want out of a game like this that it doesnt have is real cars. All the vehicles in game are fictious which is fine but getting to work on real vehicles and get to know their inner worksing would be fun. Licensing would probably make it cost too much though.

The first game like this I ever played was Gear Head Garage put out by Snap-On. The game was crude but had a huge mod group where people made real cars for the game to fix up and sell.  That game prompted me to purchase this game and I have to say as a real auto/truck tech the game is very much like real life. Every symptom I have seen from the customer was correct to the causes.  How ever there is one thing that really bugs me. The game requires removal of items to get to another item that you really dont have to do in real life. Example is there was one job that required the replacement of the exhaust manifold. To do this you have to remove the rear muffler, the rear exhaust pipe, the middle muffler, the middle exhaust pipe, the catalytic converter, and the forward exhaust pipe before you can remove the exhaust manifold.  When I have had to do this at work I have never removed the whole exhaust system, I have always broke the exhaust loose at the manifold to header pipe connection and then removed the manifold.  This is where this game in my opinion could be improved on is allowing the items to be removed without having to remove the whole system when it is not required. Its like removal of the front strut you have to take the sway bar end link off first. Well I dont remove them I remove the end that is attached to the strut and then remove the strut. Like wise in the game the strut only has four bolts holding it to the spindle arm when in reality its two bolts with another three to six bolts holding it to the unibody at the top of the strut.  While these complaints are minor and do not effect the game itself I still recommend the game for those that want to experience real diaganostics and troubleshooting of vehicle problems.
Good game but the loading time kills it for me. Was a great game.

I really do like this game. That being said, I only bought this because it was on sale. I think I paid 6 dollars or something. If you like cars and want to learn a generalization of them. This is good! Would recommend buy only if its on sale.

But will fill your time nicely if you are looking for a change in your normal genre.

FIVE POINT SYSTEM REVIEW WARNING!!! * I've got a five point system review, in that it scores a point if it seems to achieve what it's going for, this is by no way, shape, or form good nor bad. It simply means, I personally felt that it achieved what it was going for and nothing more. Graphics, music/sound is self explanitory, Gameplay refers to controls and functionality. Genre refers to if it achieves it's actual Genre, if it's a simulation, did it achieve being that? Genre is broad, but can be fudged up by developers. Overall fun, refers to if I had fun or if maybe I think you'll have fun with this title. With that in mind, onto the review. *  Graphics: 1 Point = Yes, graphics were decent, but could have been slightly better. Music/Sound: 1 Point = Yes, though the music could have added more tracks to seem less repititive. Gameplay: 1 Point = Functions well, felt very natural from the very start. Genre: 1 Point = Tis advertised as a Car Mechanic Simulator, and in many degrees it achieves such. Overall: 1 Point = It's very fun, HOWEVER, latter levels seem more of a chore. Total: 5/5  My first impresions of the game were quite fond, everything was new, and I had to figure out, A) What was wrong with the car, and B) How to get it out, and replace it. For some levels, it took me a few trys, like figuring out where the spark plugs were and how to get to them. Mostly, it was pretty easy once you get the flow of things in the game. Replacing parts I've never replaced earlier felt exciting. Rear Axel here, 4 wheel drive there, replace muffler ect.  It wasn't long before I mastered this game and quickly was gaining cash. It's here were fun started to turn into a bit of a chore. Everything was too easy towards the latter levels of the game. I knew how to do everything and beat all 75 levels within 2 days. I even replaced one cars whole parts just to stop the game from being mundane. To say there isn't enough to do is an understatement, while the early stages are fun, there really isn't much stopping you from plowing through this game. Latter stages are repitive, but are still fun in their own right.  I'd still recommend this title, and see that it has potential, however, I think you should wait till the DLC and content updates come for this game before buying. It's a good game, just not as good as you may hope.
This is a really great game if you want to learn more about how cars work!
Is good if you want to know about cars would like more in it like big jobs engine overhalls ext not really lives up to it's name but still good fun
Very, very, very fun and cool game. :)

This game is NOT like Gear Head Garage if anyone reamembers that game. But it is a lot of fun. But it does certainly has room for improvement. But I higlhly recommend playing the DEMO first before blindly purchasing it based on players reviews.   I sort went into this game thinking cool another Gear Head Garage game, but sadly it is not that in any shape or form. First off you are given jobs, and given a certain amount of how much the job cost. It is up to you to pin point the problem based on what the customer said or by test driving, or doing a test tech in bigger garages.   One thing I learned while playing is the vehicle will have a lot of red parts, but you won't have enough money to buy/fix them all, just buy/fix what the person wanted and send it on its way. Buying/Fixing the red parts will put your shop in a early grave, so while tempting. Just DON'T do it.  One job that really threw people off was the fuel filter job. While having replaced the fuel filter in my car recently. I knew it was in or near the gas tank, so I went there right away. But other's stumbled on this job for a long time.   Now I said this game has much needed improvements.  Like jobs, they need to be rewarding or graded on how well you did also if you missed something major.   They should of done a story line or something to make the game interesting, but there really isn't any voices. And if you shut music off it's really really really quiet. Other than the occasional sound of the nuts coming off  Also the ability to just build a vehicle from the ground up and they paint it cool and sell it. While this isn't technically what mechanic does, this game based on the jobs, isn't technically what a mechanic does either, I never been to a shop where the customer pays for the job first, unless it's routine maintenance. With that being said it should have the option of adding parts in case there is a bigger problem than originially thought.  Also there needs to be more parts. Able to fix more parts. More second hand parts,, in much better condition. Since most of those parts are bit of a rip off. Also the parts cost a lot. I mean A LOT. Oil Filter costing 50 bucks.  The camera angle is something to be desired. especially in the back of the vehicle. I had a hard time viewing the vehicle. Sometimes the WASD buttons would reverse.    How do you get to bigger badder garages, by doing jobs, that is how. I am not sure how long I played but didn't seem like very long and I got my 2nd garage pretty fast.   Changing oil is pretty routine. But changing oil in the 2nd garage is odd. You have put it in this catch oil pan and you have be very percise where it is or you lose 100 dollars. The first garage wasn't like that you just drained the oil and that was that. Just seems to be a step back, instead of a step forward. And in the 2nd garage for sure, why can't you now fix tires? One of the tires in the game cost either 1600 or 1700 for one tire, I could see if it was all 4 tires. But this is just one tire. Jobs don't pay a lot, so replcaining one tire is really expensive.   On the plus side of things there is going to be FREE DLC. So perhaps some improvements in game play as well more things to do. While I do reommend this game. I really recommend playing the DEMO first.   Here is hoping the Car Mechanic Simulator 2015 is taking the ideas of the fans and making EVEN better than the original.

Surprisingly nice little game. You might think of it as a puzzle game that can help you learn how cars are built. Yes, it's not 100% accurate, but it will give you a pretty good general idea. The mechanics (pun not intended) of the game are pretty simple, you have to find the broken part and replace it. Very simple idea, but it can be quite fun and relaxing, and netting you some car mechanic knowledge in the meantime.   There is nothing competitive here, you will not be judged or measured against others, so you can just chill out and fix those cars.

A lot of different reviews have come up about this game. Some have been quite negative, based on some of the limited functionality one can do when repairing a car, while the majority of them have been really positive. Personally this has been a really exciting game to play. Yes there are some limitations on what you can repair (e.g. disassemble of the engine block), but for someone that has limited knowledge of an engine, this would be chanellaging.  Really looking forward to what is being developed for the future. 10 / 10
This game is very glitchy with my laptop !! but still i ocasionaly play it and can be very fun . but i think there needs more realism!! over all i give it 3and a half stars
It is a fun game if you have time and like cars
car for the car guys worth every dime. very fun trouble shooting

Its a good game and concept but there should be more interaction with the car. I have played car simulation games with bad graphics back in the day and had alot more stuff to do, like going to the auction to buy a car in some shape or form to rebuild and resell, on top of working on customer cars. Like being able to tear down an engine all the way to the crankshaft, removing interiors such as seats and exterior body parts if the customer were to get in a fender bender. If you want ideas you should check out the game called gearhead garage if it will even run on any of the new computers I can get it to run on mine but it takes alot of tweaking. I would like to see somemore in depth engine repair and body mods and some more vehicle choices

100% Recommended at the $7 sale price. $20 for the regular price and I still think it's worth it. I'm 61/75 on the normal orders and still have 20 left on the offroad add-on.  Gameplay is smooth on ultra settings, except I have OA and DOF disabled because of my old GeForce 9600 GSO and running 1600x900 native resolution.  Game still looks very good with those settings.  The camera can be bothersome at times, but you can click on any part near the part you actually need to focus the camera quickly.   The only downfall is the repetative gameplay itself but it's still engaging and pushes you on to complete the order, and the next, and the next.  Personally I wish there was more depth, like being able to actually delve into the engine, or replace U-Joints and smaller stuff. But I understand this game is meant for everyone and people that don't know a lot about cars could get lost.  I would just like to see difficulty settings. Normal and Hardcore where Hardcore is much more mechanically inclined.  All in all, I recommend this title.

This game is a great concept, but it's a bit unfinished. If you don't really know much about cars, you're not gonna know what to do. the game doesn't offer up much in hints if you get stuck, and it's not really the best in telling you exactly what it wants you to do. That taken into account, yeah, i enjoy this game, and i recommend it. it's pretty fun, nothing mind blowing. and if you can stumble through it, you might learn a thing or two.  my main gripe is the lack of fluid lines. Usually how i'd try and feel out an unfamiliar car is i'd tract the fluid lines. In this one, you have no real way of knowing the fuel filter is in the rear, Also the camera is pretty bad. Like really really bad. You can only tilt it, and you can't morve or pan it. If this game got an update fixing the camera issue, it'd be really really good.
Pretty in depth mechanic sim. Very entertaining, keeps crashing though.

Spent 30 minutes trying to find a bloody fuel filter while dismantling the entire vehicle then got confused and crashed a car but it was ok afterwards help me i know nothing about cars 11/10 would get lost in again

I like it for $15 but the game feels a bit rushed in development.   For instance when someone brings a car in that has a leak, you can't ask what color the leaked fluid is. The grammar in the repair notes is really bad.  A lot of the times the notes are so vague that you have to disassemble the entire car to find the problem.  That being said I didn't really know anything about what goes on under the hood and this did help me a lot, I wish they'd spent more time on it and made it more realistic.

Pure Awesomness!!! Worth Every single buck paid for!!! Best game Right after Euro Truck Simulator 2, Best Game and Why? if you are a mechanic or Want to be an aspiring mechanic it`s The game for you Out of 10 I rate 9000/10
Good game, but it's not Gearhead Garage. Lacks a few things, but maybe they will come in the future. Looking forward to the 4x4 and turbo DLC.

Excited to hear about the 4x4 add-on coming out later. Who knows, maybe they will make my day, and whip out a Semi Truck to work on ! Anything is possible, thank you CMS 2014 developers. I appreciate your time and efforts.
The agony of fixing cars, without the smell!

A kick back to the era of gearhead garage. If you loved that game, you will find some enjoyment out of this. It's not as in-depth as gearhead garage was, but a good step in the right direction.   Minor issues such as not locking the mouse to the active window resulting in the game losing focus with multi-monitor setups at times. Other than that, a very solid and stable game.  The little bit I have played of this, I have really enjoyed it and will be playing more in the future.
Most in depth game ever, very useful information and gets you to really think.
Great game. The only issue is thst when I walk around the garage its very laggy but all stops in the car parts website and when I focus in on the engine.

I would recommend this game but only with warning: Only a specific type of gamer will enjoy this! I enjoy it as something to pass a little time on another games update or a few missions at a time. The game is decent but flawed IMO. I'm on a order in the 2nd shop and the complaint is something about 'engine wont start, need it tomorrow' or something...However I have replaced the damaged engine components and have even TEST driven the car but I cannot select 'Repaired' to complete the order.....WHY WOULD I BE ABLE TO TEST DRIVE IT WITH THE ENGINE 'NOT RUNNING'....simple things like this kinda ruin sims for me. But Overall I would give it a 6/10 rating for that certain casual gamer not looking to shoot an aliens face or run and gun gerbals in a 10x10 map.

Found it interesting, as a car enthusiast I always wanted a good idea about suspension and what not is thrown together, I do recommend as I played it 12 hours solid. What would have made it more interesting for me would be being able to get into the engine block. At least being able to change out the cams and crank and even the pistons, 3 extra components wouldnt have been hard to implement surely?  The turbo dlc should make things more interesting if you can set psi and add boost controllers and such. I think what would make it perfect for me would be customers asking for performance mods. Since whats a good remap and chip tune without some breath mods to go with it like performance exhaust and filters. I think adding performance parts and see how they affect the car performance would bring more people to the game.

Overall I liked the game, but it's not great. I think I got the game for $10 when I bought it. The game is definately not optimized, it runs my computer at 90%. Its more than any other game I have, so its just bad coding there. I was hoping this game would help me learn more about the inner workings of cars. But, it really didn't. I guess if you knew nothing about cars at all it would help. I like the problem solving aspect of the game which is what saves the game in my opinion.

Not a bad way to kill time but don't expect anything too challenging here. If you know a little about cars and like to tinker is it good fun and easy to diagnose and repair the cars.   Real car mechanics / enthusiasts shouldn't expect much in the way of accuracy or simulation. Some things are a little strange like when you take a brake caliper off and the pads are still there floating beside the rotor, or how you have to take apart an entire air intake all the way to the throttle body just to replace an air filter.  But, it still is a good time waster.  The test drive mode should have either been not included or it needs to be upgraded, badly. Every car drives the same no matter what the issue. I even took a car for a test drive that supposedly wouldn't start! Ok.. sure if you listen you can hear the brakes squeak on some cars but that is the only difference i have ever heard so far. The test driving just feels like a chore and the element of fun has worn off by the third or fourth time you have to do one.  All in all, I'll play though it. I'm around 4 hours in and about 1/3 completed with the career.  Final Thoughts: It's hard to call this a game. There isn't a lot of game aspects to it. If you like to teardown stuff and put it back together, this is a good diversion for what it is. The graphics are good, but I can hear my vid card run like it has never ran before, which sort of tells me that it could be optimized a little better. There are only a handful of cars and most of the time it will not matter which car it is because they all share most of the same components, so when you are tearing them down, there isn't much different between the cars.  I know that is a lot of cons, but I still enjoy playing it.. It reminds me of when I was a child and wanted to take apart all of my own toy cars. For that alone I will give it an 8/10
Fun and simple... great product from a kickstarter project!!

Well have they got a game for you! Car Mechanic simulator will have you fixing busted vehicles faster than you can slam that Big Gulp full of Mountain Dew!  7/11 you'll be in Automotive heaven
Oddly addictive for a sim about fixing cars, A subject I have no interest in.

I got this in a bundle, and this was one of the reasons I purchased the bundle. It might sound a bit dull and boring, but is better than I thought it would be, the game is also perhaps slightly educational. Only gripe is the viewing angles can sometimes be a bit awkard and diffcult to get to, and for someone with no experience of cars in a mechanical sense, some parts can be difficult to find and locate first time around. I did have to watch a couple of youtube videos of others playing the game to find where some parts were. The physics on the test track are also a bit poor. However the game can be played with an erection and I am sure I will return and play it it small doses a few levels at a time as even though you do click on different bits in the levels, it can be a bit repetitive. I would not pay the full asking price though, but worth picking up if its in a bundle or on sale.

This is actually really cool. A good idea that is well executed, with just enough detail to make a non-mechanic feel as though he's solving simplified real-world car issues, while avoiding making it un-approachable with cumbersome controls or means of interacting with the vehicles.  A good game, I definitely recommend for anyone wanting, well, a Car Mechanic Simulator that's easy to approach.

Dah! 2 Days after purchasing two copies (one for me and one for my son), it goes on sale 50% off! That's the breaks, I guess!   Gameplay is good, graphics are nice, and no pesky grease-covered hands at the end of the day. Bonus! The missions are pretty easy, at least in the beginning. Haven't had one stump me yet, and I know hardly anything about vehicle maintenance. Seems like I have heard the possibility of a CMS 2015...anxious to see the improvements. 2014 is fun enought that I would probably purchase a 2015 version.

Well, how do I say it... I recommend it if you can get it really cheap, like I did.  This game is considerably detailed and can give a hint on car mechanics, specially for those not really aware of it (which I doubt there will be many, since if you bought this or is thinking about buying it, you probably like car mechanics a lot). The major issue for me, is that most things are simplified and worst, all cars look the same 'under skin'. Yes, you have the 4x4 that adds some differences, but I don't think there are that many.   There is a nice touch of discovery on some of the missions, like 'My car won't start! Please fix!' but the missions end up being a lot like one another, which for me is a drawback. There is not enough complexity to keep things running for too long.  Now, the major and most disappointing thing: the 1/4 mile Add on. I was hoping to get some real nice parts, to be able to exchange pistons and crankshafts, play with gear rations and stuff, but it ended up as a simplistic 'this part gives 8% power' and you just change it as it was done on the 'fix it' part of the game. Ok, small 'click until right' tunning session and finish.  Like I said in the beggining, if you like mechanics and can buy it cheap, do it. It will entertain you for about 4hs.
Played this game for a little while,  i am now capable of owning my own garage
great fun realistic parts and actions
Love this game! I'm really hoping that a more in-depth sequel is made because I will definitely be purchasing it!
The whole point in this game is to take good parts off of customer's cars and replace them with bad ones ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°) 10/10
I don't know if it is my commputer or not if u have a bad pc don't get it good pc get it

I was pretty excited when I heard of this game the first time, and in the last few years we have seen the whackiest ideas followed by a -simulator in the title. I'm not just referring to Goat Simulator, but also Constructor Simulator, Bus Driver Simulator, etc. I'm mostly attracted to all the -simulator titles, but I often feels they're made cheaply by german people that really don't play videogames that much. This Car Mechanic Simulator instead feels really polished, has a streamlined menu and interface and everything is pretty much satisfying to watch and play. The game is fun and a mindless pasttime, but it feels repetitive after a while. I also feel they've wasted a chance with the driving track, which saying is badly used is an understatement. It doesn't matter what you do or how you drive, get to the end and you'll have your report, so I tend to avoid it while I can because it's incredibly useless.    PRO
I love this game! It's like a puzzle trying to figure out what needs to be fixed and how to do it with out spending too much money.
Yes i do recommand this game for only playing a little bit. Would recommend buying 2015!
Great game if you only need a quick past time.
NOt bad. Got me interested in the 2015 version.

I expected something in the vicinity of gearhead garage but it truly wasnt. I had been looking forward to this game and perhaps therefore my expectations were a tad too high. This game seems hastily thrown together, all the cars look like ssangyongs or toyotas, they all seem to be mostly front wheel drive, front engined, there are no v8s, there seems to be no variation what so ever except a few exterior details.  Yes the fact that you could drive the cars to diagnose them would have been a nice touch if it didnt feel like I was driving a maxed out clown car propelled by rubber bands with suspension made out of matches.   The worst part is that I dont seem to get to buy my own car, fixing it up and trying to turn a profit but rather grind my way through repetetive tasks with a bunch of whiny women who are not able to change their oil or even their own air filter.
Fun for a bit but gets too repetitive and just becomes a chore.   not recommened for people who are trying to learn about cars as it just drops you into the ocean

Car Mechanic Sim 2014 this game could be so much better, if you dont know much about cars you cant play this game. On the to do list it says something and then doesnt even give you a clue where it is. IF you know a lot about car mechanics then this is a good game for you but not for anyone else.

The idea was nice but apart from the running gag about the dumb woman driver, which I seriously could have done without, the cars in game seem to have been designed by someone who's looked carefully at pictures of car parts but never actually worked on a car. Exhaust manifolds which bolt to the engine block rather then the head and which cant be removed without disassembling the entire exhaust system first. Front engined RWD cars with transversely mounted engines. Brake systems with no master cylinder and induction systems with no injectors or throttle body. Suspension arms that bolt rigidly to the spindles with no ball joints. Batteries and suspension arms that can be rebuilt at a workbench (just let me get my hammer...). The list goes on. So a cute idea, but they should have perhaps involved an actual mechanic. I'm still kind of curious about the sequel but I won't be paying full price for it.
I didn't find it fun, might be educational.  Sorry
This game be bogus AF.
When I bought this game, I had no idea how to be a car mechanic. Now, after playing a few hours, I still don't know how to fix ♥♥♥♥.

Dumb.   As an actual mechanic, i expected it to be far less complex than car repair actually is... but i never imagined it being this bad. The job where you have to do an obd scan on the car, i thought alright lets see whats wrong going on......doesnt even give errors or any info, scan complete, job done, same money as replacing a starter? Taking the intake mainfold off is just one click, but i have to wrench 4 bolts out of the airbox? Able to remove the fuel filter, which was located betweeen the fuel tank and body of the car, without removing the tank?  I realize that if the game were too in depth it would be too hard and boring for most people. But i think a happy medium is needed and this is far from it. Neglects to mention simple things that people should know like lug pattern tightening. Guy says needs air, oil, fuel filter changes... changing the oil filter but not the oil? When you need new parts for a car, no looking up making sure you get the right parts, all parts fit every single car. Spare parts laying around fit every car. Hit it with a hammer, brand new again.  I paid $1.69 for this game and im not even gonna request a refund since i got 54 minutes time waste outta it. Still i dont think its worth paying money to play. In fact even if they offered me money to play it i would still probably decline.

Firstly, I'm disappointed that I can't give this game a neutral recommendation. Because that's what I wanted to do.  Secondly, I'm a little dissapointed in the game. I've only played the first mission and believe it will get slightly better, but as of now I'm disappointed in the lack of realism. I was hoping to gain enough confidence to preform real work. I wanted to be able to select car jacks and measure nut and bolt sizes. I wanted to be able to tighten bolts to specifications. I wanted to be able to shop for different brands of brake pads and purchase brake pads for specific cars. 50 dollars for one brake pad is so unrealistic.   The game looks nice and was quick to setup. I will probably continue playing this.
Awful, just awful. The mouse controls are just ridiculous and make it near impossible to do anything. Music is just irritating. Never even got to try out the gameplay and never will.
Not enough content.

This isn't a simulation. Only a few parts of the cars are interactive, so the game quickly become VERY repetitive. I hoped to improve my knowledge in mechanic but there is nothing to learn in this game...
Don't buy this, I usually don't write reviews, especially bad recommendations because I know development can be a cruel process, however, this game is crap.
update has been paused for a month and cannot get any support
Ahh im so sorry but i don like it i give it 2/10  I mean its very hard to control i dont understand sometimes what i need to do. If you want to be mechanic you should try... But yeah sorry :(
this game is ♥♥♥♥ing ♥♥♥♥ and will only download half ive been trying for three days and it wont work

This game is not sensible. They obviously never consulted with a real mechanic. Instead of fun, the game is tedious and boring (and truly idiotic - why do I have to remove EVEYTHING to change the fuel filter? Why?)
this game sucks

I can hear some noises from game (The game is not 'Not responding' condition) even the screen is all black but this is not how to play the game though...  *My PC : Core i5, 8G Ram, Intel HD 3000 graphic card. pretty confusing bad controls
Atleast the uninstall function works.
absolutly boring!

I love cars. I love the idea of working on cars. Cars and 'missions' become more complicated over time, and the garage becomes more elaborate.  Unfortunately, this game locks up for me constantly - computer crashes and I am forced to reboot. Red Dot's support offers me nothing other than a brick wall.  Despite really enjoying the game, I cannot recommend it as even Red Dot cannot provide support and although I can run Skyrim without issue, inexplicably this game seems to crash...often.  If Red Dot can actually support those that buy their games, this review is subject to change.

It's a very nice idea and mostly well made. But a few horrible things make the game unplayable for me. Graphics and sound are good enough, but the interface is very lacking.  Main problem: the way way camera/mouse behaves. It's hard to describe, but you have to move the mouse VERY carefully or you end up swaggering - every time you move the mouse, the camera moves too.  Another problem is the game doesn't really help you - I'm no mechanic. I have no idea where the fuel filter might be (somewhere near the gas tank, I'd assume?). Unfortunately, the game doesn't even indicate where the item in question might be, unless you're already very close. (Case in point, until you think of lifting the car, you don't even know there's another place to tinker UNDER the car. All other options are constantly shown (hood, wheels, side door), but not the one below the car, even if it's directly part of your current job?  A minor nuisance: to change game settings you have to leave the current game mode and get to the main screen again.
I dont know about you guys, but in my pc the graphic is not good... Hard to control with the mouse... Just play it a little then trash

I'm not sure this is a simulator so much as a simple mock up of what a mechanic shop might look like if you were, say, 14. Buy it for the kiddies or you want something very basic, but not if you've ever done more than simple maintenance on a car.
Don't get this game.... its laggy and buggy. and poor graphics. Get mechanic simulator 2015.
Not working on Razer edge(Windows 8.1) :(

very unimpressive, i stay away from most simulator games cause more often than not they fail to provide you with a reason to play longer than 15min, i should have stayed away from this one too, i expected to work on a variety of cars not just 2-3(4?) brand spanking new cars in different colors, i dont understand the reason for the test course, it doesent matter if you take a car thats down to 30% condition on everything or one thats tip top, it runs equally crappy(first time i tested that luxury sedan i thought i was driving my old nissan cherry 1L on 2 cylinders again). i had hoped to see classic cars too, work inside the engine and gearbox, this is just a plain joke, what you do here is mostly what the average person can do on his own. camera sensitivity is horrible, maybe you can change it in a config file but not adding in the option was plain lazy. the way the camera snaps back and forth when you interact with parts is especially annoying, why no just let people zoom in as much as they want and leave them alone? there is more id like to complain about but likely noone wants to read this much as it is.

The game looks good, but thats it. the camera is a nightmare, the controls change sensitivity, the operations become too repetitive, some parts disassembly/assembly are from unrealistic points, non usable parts highlight and annoy, the prices are unreal to say the least, driving controls are below average, no point in buying used parts as they either broken or not accepted by the customer. don't buy.

If I was able to actually play this game, I may recommend it. But once I downloaded it, it stated that I had to upgrade to a different video card. It was never stated in the description that you needed to upgrade that. It stated the compatibility with certain microsoft versions, in which mine was listed but it still didnt work. It just froze up my computer and that was it.
